_comment: Created by ianb on 14/10/2013 11:42:48 using v0.9
title: How has placement to stroke beds changed?
analysis_commentary: NICE stroke guidelines launched in 2008 recommend that all people with suspected stroke should be admitted directly to a specialist acute stroke unit following initial assessment either from the community or in an A&E department. In order to measure this, the time taken between arrival at hospital to arrival at a stroke bed is recorded. The proportion of people who arrived at a stroke bed within four hours increased by 11.0 percentage points in 18 months to a high of 65.0% in Oct-Dec 2012.
data_source: Royal College of Physicians, National Stroke Audit
